newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss KOF economic barometer rises 0.1 pct in May.
newsitem.headline: Swiss KOF economic barometer rises 0.1 pct in May.

text.p: Switzerland's Institute for Business Cycle Research (KOF) said its economic barometer rose a provisional 0.1 percent in May for a year-on-year rise of 1.3 percent.
In April the barometer rose 0.2 percent for a revised year-on-year rise of 1.4 percent, KOF said in a statement.

"The prospects for a slight pickup in the economy from the second half of 1997 and its extension in the early months of next year thus remain intact," said KOF, part of the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH).

KOF noted that among its leading indicators the Manpower Index of vacant jobs rose and employment prospects for the industrial sector were up in the first quarter, which points to a slight improvement in the labour markets.
Work on hand in the machinery sector also edged up and the decline in construction leading indicators slowed. Real money supply did not rise as sharply as in the previous month, it said.
